page.title: 13A DAIRY FARM AT SHAWHEAD
page.content: During July Mr Ross and his father get up at 6.45am every morning and start the milking. They milk 44 cows. Breakfast is at 8.00am then they feed the beasts, 20 Galloway beef cows. The milk tanker collects the milk every second day. Before lunch which is from 12.00 to 1.00pm, they check for couped sheep. Then they have lunch. The farmers have a helper called Ian who helps with the hay. First they cut the hay with a mower and leave it to dry. Next the haybob turns the hay over twice. when it is ready they row it up, bale it and stack it on a clamp which takes 17 bales. The second milking is from 3.00 to 3.45pm. Tea is from 4.00 to 4.45pm. After tea they work until all the hay in the field is baled. There are 15 acres of hay and 45 acres of silage.
